div.l: Wel bet is roten appel out of hoord
Than þat it rotie all þe remenant
So farith it by a ryotous seruant
It is ful lasse harme to late him passe
Than he schende all þe seruaıı̄untes in þe place
Therfore his maister ȝaf him a quitaıı̄unce
And bad him goo with sorwe and meschaıı̄unce
And thus þis Ioly prentys had his leue
Now lete him riote al the nyght or leue
And for ther is no theef with oute a louke
That helpith him to wasten ⁊and to sowke
Of þat he bribe can or borwe may
Anon he sente his bedde ⁊and his array
Vnto a Conper of his owne sort
That loued dys reuel and disport
And had a wyf þat held for contynaıı̄unce
A schoppe ⁊and swyfed for here sustenaıı̄unce
But here of I wil passe as now
And of ȝonge Gamelyn I wil telle ȝow
Here by gynnyth þe tale of gamelyn
Lithen and lesteneth ⁊and herkeneth aright
And ye schul here of a doughti knight
Sire Iohn of Boıı̄undis was his name
He coude of norture and of mochil game
Thre sones the knyght had ⁊and with his body he hem wan
The eldest was a moche shrewe ⁊and sone he bigan
His breth̉ren loued wele here fader and of him were agast
The eldest diserued his fader curs ⁊and had it at þe last
The good knyght his fader lyued so ȝore
That deth was comen him to ⁊and handeled him ful sore
The gode knight cared sore sike þere he lay
How his children schulde lyuen after his day
He hadde ben wide where but none housbonde he was
Al þe londe þat he hadde it was v̉erray purchas
Fayn he wolde it were . dressid among hem alle
That eche of hem had his part as it myght falle
Tho sent he into cuntre after wise knyghtes
To helpen delen his londes ⁊and dressen hem to rightes
